title: Stop spreading fake news KL is unsafe, home minister warns
summary: Home Minister Datuk Seri Saifuddin Nasution Ismail has urged the public to stop spreading false information portraying Kuala Lumpur as unsafe for living or visiting.
content:
KUALA NERUS (Aug 31): Home Minister Datuk Seri Saifuddin Nasution Ismail has urged the public to stop spreading false information portraying Kuala Lumpur as unsafe for living or visiting.

He stated that disseminating such unreliable information is a highly irresponsible act.

“It has come to our attention that while the nation is focused on the sinkhole which resulted in a casualty, a small number of irresponsible netizens are spreading fake news.<

title: KL sinkhole: Search and rescue ops halted for 'search and recovery' phase
summary: The search and rescue (SAR) operation for the Indian national who fell into a sinkhole on Jalan Masjid India here has been halted, with efforts now shifting to the 'search and recovery' phase.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Aug 31): The search and rescue (SAR) operation for the Indian national who fell into a sinkhole on Jalan Masjid India here has been halted, with efforts now shifting to the 'search and recovery' phase.

Minister in the Prime Minister's Department (Federal Territories) Dr Zaliha Mustafa said the decision was made after considering expert opinions and the Cabinet's views.

“We consulted with experts before making this decision. After gathering input fr

title: Observations of climate change
summary: ESG asked two individuals, who grew up in vastly different locations, to share how they have observed the climate changing and how it has impacted their lives
content: This article first appeared in The Edge Malaysia Weekly on August 12, 2024 - August 18, 2024

title: Hunt for Fed-pivot winners sparks a rush to Malaysia, Indonesia
summary: Global investors are boosting exposure to Indonesia and Malaysia on bets the two markets will benefit more than their developing-nation peers as the US Federal Reserve (Fed) looks set to embark on monetary easing.
content:
(Aug 31): Global investors are boosting exposure to Indonesia and Malaysia on bets the two markets will benefit more than their developing-nation peers as the US Federal Reserve (Fed) looks set to embark on monetary easing.

Sound fiscal policies and focus on new technology sectors such as electric vehicles (EVs) and data centres are among factors attracting funds to the two Southeast Asian markets, which have long been overshadowed by bigger rivals India and China. Conviction is growing that the

title: Ringgit seen to trade higher next week
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The ringgit is expected to trade higher against the US dollar next week on a sustained demand for the local currency.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The ringgit is expected to trade higher against the US dollar next week on a sustained demand for the local currency.

Bank Muamalat Malaysia Bhd chief economist Dr Mohd Afzanizam Abdul Rashid said the ringgit is likely to breach its immediate support level of RM4.3030 in the near term.

He also noted that among the economic data to be monitored next week are Bank Negara Malaysia's Monetary Policy Committee Meeting and the US' non-farm payrolls.

"If o

title: The Week Ahead: Bank Negara OPR decision, implementation of US tariff on Chinese imports in focus
summary: Bank Negara Malaysia will be the only Asian central bank with a monetary policy decision this week, which is expected on Sept 5.
content:
This article first appeared in The Edge Malaysia Weekly on September 2, 2024 - September 8, 2024

Bank Negara Malaysia will be the only Asian central bank with a monetary policy decision this week, which is expected on Sept 5.

According to an Aug 30 Bloomberg poll of three analysts, the central bank is expected to keep its policy rate steady at 3%.

title: UOB’s Wee on driving the business through values and culture
summary: Had Wee Ee Cheong, the deputy chairman and chief executive officer of United Overseas Bank Ltd (UOB), not followed in the footsteps of his father and grandfather, he likely would have been a doctor today.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Aug 31): Had Wee Ee Cheong, the deputy chairman and chief executive officer of United Overseas Bank Ltd (UOB), not followed in the footsteps of his father and grandfather, he likely would have been a doctor today.

But as fate would have it, the third-generation leader of the Singapore-based lender, which turns 90 next year, joined the family business in 1979 at the behest of his father, the late Wee Cho Yaw.

UOB, the third-largest banking group in

title: King, Queen grace National Day celebration attended by PM, ministers
summary: His Majesty Sultan Ibrahim, King of Malaysia, and Her Majesty Raja Zarith Sofiah, Queen of Malaysia, graced the National Day 2024 celebration at Dataran Merdeka on Saturday morning.
content:
PUTRAJAYA (Aug 31): His Majesty Sultan Ibrahim, King of Malaysia, and Her Majesty Raja Zarith Sofiah, Queen of Malaysia, graced the National Day 2024 celebration at Dataran Merdeka on Saturday morning.

It was the first presence by Their Majesties at the country’s National Day celebration since Sultan Ibrahim was sworn in on Jan 31, and crowned as the 17th King of Malaysia on July 20.

Their Majesties arrived at 8am and were received on arrival by Prime

title: Banking, O&G stocks key bright spots
summary: KUALA LUMPUR: The banking and oil and gas (O&G) firms are a key bright spot, while the technology and healthcare sectors are generally a disappointment in the latest quarterly reporting season.Analysts said overall, listed companies' earnings for ...
content:
KUALA LUMPUR: The banking and oil and gas (O&G) firms are a key bright spot, while the technology and healthcare sectors are generally a disappointment in the latest quarterly reporting season.

Analysts said overall, listed companies' earnings for the second quarter (Q2) of financial year 2024 had been largely robust.

CIMB Securities said four out of five banks under its coverage had reported better-than-expected earnings.

Out of the 73 companies that released their Q2 results up until Aug 28, CIMB Securiti

title: Oil prices settle US$1 down as supply set to rise
summary: Oil prices retreated on Friday as investors weighed expectations of a rise in Opec+ supply starting in October, alongside dwindling hopes of a hefty US interest rate cut next month, following data showing strong consumer spending.
content:
Brent crude futures for October delivery settled US$1.14 lower, or 1.43%, at US$78.80 a barrel. US West Texas Intermediate crude futures settled down US$2.36, or 3.11%, to US$73.55.

HOUSTON: Oil prices retreated on Friday as investors weighed expectations of a rise in Opec+ supply starting in October, alongside dwindling hopes of a hefty US interest rate cut next month, following data showing strong consumer sp

title: Dow notches record high on upbeat economic data
summary: Wall Street stocks rose and the Dow scored a second consecutive all-time closing high on Friday, with Tesla and Amazon climbing after fresh US economic data raised expectations that the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates modestly in September.
content:
The S&P 500 climbed 1.01% to end at 5,648.40 points. The Nasdaq climbed 1.13% to 17,713.62 points, while the Dow rose 0.55% to 41,563.08 points.

NEW YORK: Wall Street stocks rose and the Dow scored a second consecutive all-time closing high on Friday, with Tesla and Amazon climbing after fresh US economic data raised expectations that the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates modestly in September.

title: Wall St Week Ahead: US stock rally broadens, eye on Fed
summary: A broadening rally in US stocks is offering an encouraging signal to investors worried about concentration in technology shares, as markets await key jobs data and the Federal Reserve's expected rate cuts in September.
content:
Many investors view the broadening trend as a healthy development in a market rally led by a cluster of giant tech names. — AFP

NEW YORK: A broadening rally in US stocks is offering an encouraging signal to investors worried about concentration in technology shares, as markets await key jobs data and the Federal Reserve's expected rate cuts in September.

summary: Here is a brief recap of some business news and corporate announcements that made the headlines on Friday

title: Smoothing the way for EVs
summary: While the electric vehicle (EV) ecosystem is growing fast, there are challenges that need to be addressed for the market to thrive.
content:
Beep co-founder and CEO Kristoffer Jacek Soh.

WHILE the electric vehicle (EV) ecosystem is growing fast, there are challenges that need to be addressed for the market to thrive.

Fragmentation in the market, roaming-connectivity issues, and the lack of shared platforms among EV partners are some of the hurdles that could affect the growth of the market.

title: Taking a leaf of electricity reforms from other countries
summary: Many countries have allowed third-party access (TPA) to their power grids as part of broader energy market reforms aimed at increasing competition and efficiency.
content:
TPA enables independent power producers, suppliers, or other entities to access the transmission and distribution networks for electricity, promoting innovation among renewable energy producers.

title: Ekovest narrows 4Q net loss to RM64.9m
summary: Ekovest Bhd (KL:EKOVEST) narrowed its net loss to RM64.87 million for its fourth quarter ended June 30, 2024 (4QFY2024) from RM95.66 million a year earlier, helped by a turnaround in the performance of its associate.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Aug 30): Ekovest Bhd (KL:EKOVEST) narrowed its net loss to RM64.87 million for its fourth quarter ended June 30, 2024 (4QFY2024) from RM95.66 million a year earlier, helped by a turnaround in the performance of its associate.

The associate's share of profit of RM9.85 million compares with a loss of RM117,000 previously, according to the financial results filed with the stock exchange on Friday.

title: Takaful Malaysia posts marginally higher 2Q profit as revenue climbs
summary: Syarikat Takaful Malaysia Keluarga Bhd's (KL:TAKAFUL) net profit for the second quarter ended June 30, 2024 (2QFY2024) came in at RM93.10 million, marginally higher than the RM91.88 million it made in 2QFY2023, as revenue rose.
content:
KUALA LUMPUR (Aug 30): Syarikat Takaful Malaysia Keluarga Bhd's (KL:TAKAFUL) net profit for the second quarter ended June 30, 2024 (2QFY2024) came in at RM93.10 million, marginally higher than the RM91.88 million it made in 2QFY2023, as revenue rose.

Takaful revenue climbed to RM862.47 million from RM717.24 million in 2QFY2023, its bourse filing on Friday showed, mainly attributable to higher contribution release of RM75.9 million and higher amo
